entries.title: Infrastructure as code
entries.description: We standardized around Terraform for all our Infrastructure providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)

timeline.description: We standardized around Terraform for all our Infrastructure providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)

entries.title: Standardized code reviews
entries.description: Although most of our projects are covered by code reviews, having a standardized reviewing process (aggregating from the best practices across all our projects) will allow us to improve the quality of the development process and deliver a consistent experience to our customers. Detailed reasoning in internal decision record ZDR-0002.

timeline.description: Although most of our projects are covered by code reviews, having a standardized reviewing process (aggregating from the best practices across all our projects) will allow us to improve the quality of the development process and deliver a consistent experience to our customers. Detailed reasoning in internal decision record ZDR-0002.

entries.title: Ansible
entries.description: Ansible's role has been significantly diminished and will no longer be used for config management at the VM level (given that most projects now run on Kubernetes). However, we will keep using Ansible to deploy certain Helm charts inside Kubernetes clusters.

timeline.description: Ansible's role has been significantly diminished and will no longer be used for config management at the VM level (given that most projects now run on Kubernetes). However, we will keep using Ansible to deploy certain Helm charts inside Kubernetes clusters.

entries.title: Varnish
entries.description: Will be used mainly on Magento projects

timeline.description: Will be used mainly on Magento projects

entries.title: PowerBI
entries.description: PowerBI is a business analytics tool that provides interactive visualizations and BI capabilities with an interface that is easy to use for creating reports and dashboards. We like PowerBI because it supports a large number of data sources and offers a significant number of highly customizable reports and dashboards. We also like its ability to connect directly to data sources through DirectQuery. We will be using PowerBI for all our BI needs when the data warehouse/data source is in Azure.

timeline.description: PowerBI is a business analytics tool that provides interactive visualizations and BI capabilities with an interface that is easy to use for creating reports and dashboards. We like PowerBI because it supports a large number of data sources and offers a significant number of highly customizable reports and dashboards. We also like its ability to connect directly to data sources through DirectQuery. We will be using PowerBI for all our BI needs when the data warehouse/data source is in Azure.

entries.title: GitHub Copilot
entries.description: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered code assistant that promises to automate repetitive code writing tasks, while also being able to generate small blocks of code based on context. Although we feel like using Copilot incurs some extra debugging time, the experience seems to be net positive and we're inclined to recommend its adoption at the company level given the reasonable pricing. Adoption progress documented in internal decision record ZDR-0005.

timeline.description: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered code assistant that promises to automate repetitive code writing tasks, while also being able to generate small blocks of code based on context. Although we feel like using Copilot incurs some extra debugging time, the experience seems to be net positive and we're inclined to recommend its adoption at the company level given the reasonable pricing. Adoption progress documented in internal decision record ZDR-0005.

entries.title: AWS Code Deploy
entries.description: Given that we standardized the code deployment process around Kubernetes + GitLab CI or Azure DevOps Pipelines, AWS CodeDeploy is not longer necessary even for AWS-based projects.

timeline.description: Given that we standardized the code deployment process around Kubernetes + GitLab CI or Azure DevOps Pipelines, AWS CodeDeploy is not longer necessary even for AWS-based projects.

entries.title: Gulp
entries.description:
Gulp is an open-source JavaScript toolkit by Fractal Innovations and the open source community at GitHub, used as a streaming build system in front-end web development. It is a task runner built on Node.js and npm, used for automation of time-consuming and repetitive tasks involved in web development.
Will be used for non-bundling tasks.

timeline.description:
Gulp is an open-source JavaScript toolkit by Fractal Innovations and the open source community at GitHub, used as a streaming build system in front-end web development. It is a task runner built on Node.js and npm, used for automation of time-consuming and repetitive tasks involved in web development.
Will be used for non-bundling tasks.

entries.title: Wordpress
entries.description: Wordpress is extremely efficient for building simple content management platforms or corporate websites, so it looks like it will be a long-time presence in our portfolio. However, it will only be used by the digital experience team.

timeline.description: Wordpress is extremely efficient for building simple content management platforms or corporate websites, so it looks like it will be a long-time presence in our portfolio. However, it will only be used by the digital experience team.

entries.title: RabbitMQ
entries.description: RabbitMQ's excellent support for queues and pub/sub make it a good candidate for projects requiring advanced messaging features. For projects running on Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure we highly encourage our teams to first look at the messaging services offered by the respective cloud platforms, but for AWS or on-prem based workloads RabbitMQ can be the first choice.

timeline.description: RabbitMQ's excellent support for queues and pub/sub make it a good candidate for projects requiring advanced messaging features. For projects running on Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure we highly encourage our teams to first look at the messaging services offered by the respective cloud platforms, but for AWS or on-prem based workloads RabbitMQ can be the first choice.

entries.title: PostgreSQL
entries.description: PostgreSQL's excellent support for geospatial and JSON data, as well as the ability to horizontally scale the database through mature and fully automated extensions such as Citus make PostgreSQL a great candidate for the primary data source role in our projects.

timeline.description: PostgreSQL's excellent support for geospatial and JSON data, as well as the ability to horizontally scale the database through mature and fully automated extensions such as Citus make PostgreSQL a great candidate for the primary data source role in our projects.

entries.title: Vagrant
entries.description: All new projects started after Q4 2019 will be using Docker for the local development environment, so Vagrant will be completely retired.

timeline.description: All new projects started after Q4 2019 will be using Docker for the local development environment, so Vagrant will be completely retired.

entries.title: Drupal 8
entries.description: We decided to stop using Drupal 8, as the developer experience was incompatible with our current team. Furthermore, a lot of projects required simple suite-building, with little or no coding involved, which basically dillutes our competitive advantage.

timeline.description: We decided to stop using Drupal 8, as the developer experience was incompatible with our current team. Furthermore, a lot of projects required simple suite-building, with little or no coding involved, which basically dillutes our competitive advantage.

entries.title: PrestaShop
entries.description: As our experience with PrestaShop is limited and projects based on the technology are sparse, we decided to give up on it.

timeline.description: As our experience with PrestaShop is limited and projects based on the technology are sparse, we decided to give up on it.

entries.title: Magento 1.x
entries.description: We have switched to Magento 2. All new projects will be based on the new versions, while existing projects will have to be upgrade as soon as possible.

timeline.description: We have switched to Magento 2. All new projects will be based on the new versions, while existing projects will have to be upgrade as soon as possible.

entries.title: ASP.NET Core 6
entries.description: ASP.NET Core's portability, containerization support and developer experience make it the most loved back-end web framework according to Stack Overflow's Developer Survey 2022. Going forward, we will try to both start new projects on, as well as upgrade existing projects to ASP.NET Core 6.

timeline.description: ASP.NET Core's portability, containerization support and developer experience make it the most loved back-end web framework according to Stack Overflow's Developer Survey 2022. Going forward, we will try to both start new projects on, as well as upgrade existing projects to ASP.NET Core 6.

entries.title: React Admin
entries.description: React Admin is a React-based framework for building customizable admin panesl. It provides ready-to-use components for common tasks, abstracting away CRUD operations, form validation, and UI customization. This ensures a consistent user experience across different backend technologies. Its high customizability allows for a uniform look and feel across applications, regardless of specific requirements.

timeline.description: React Admin is a React-based framework for building customizable admin panesl. It provides ready-to-use components for common tasks, abstracting away CRUD operations, form validation, and UI customization. This ensures a consistent user experience across different backend technologies. Its high customizability allows for a uniform look and feel across applications, regardless of specific requirements.

entries.title: Next.JS
entries.description: Next.JS promises to deliver a more pleasant and efficient developer experience for front-end heavy applications requiring server-side rendering. We will test the framework on a customer project to validate its value proposition, but at first glance it does seem like it would be a major upgrade compared to our existing alternatives.

timeline.description: Next.JS promises to deliver a more pleasant and efficient developer experience for front-end heavy applications requiring server-side rendering. We will test the framework on a customer project to validate its value proposition, but at first glance it does seem like it would be a major upgrade compared to our existing alternatives.

entries.title: LangChain
entries.description: LangChain is an open-source framework designed to simplify and standardize the creation of end-to-end generative AI applications by integrating with a multitude of large language models (LLMs), vector databases and content sources. It is a promising technology that could significantly reduce the time and effort required to build AI applications and our experience with it so far has been quite positive, but we need to further test it in additional real-world scenarios before making a decision.

timeline.description: LangChain is an open-source framework designed to simplify and standardize the creation of end-to-end generative AI applications by integrating with a multitude of large language models (LLMs), vector databases and content sources. It is a promising technology that could significantly reduce the time and effort required to build AI applications and our experience with it so far has been quite positive, but we need to further test it in additional real-world scenarios before making a decision.

entries.title: ASP.NET MVC
entries.description: We'll be switching to ASP.NET Core/5 starting with September 2021, as it's a technology that provides significantly better developer experience, as well as compatibility with containerization technologies.

timeline.description: We'll be switching to ASP.NET Core/5 starting with September 2021, as it's a technology that provides significantly better developer experience, as well as compatibility with containerization technologies.

entries.title: Python
entries.description: Given the limited knowledge we have, as well as the difficulty experienced in finding new colleagues or customers on this technology, we will scale back our efforts and instead focus on Node.JS as the third back-end web development language in the company.

timeline.description: Given the limited knowledge we have, as well as the difficulty experienced in finding new colleagues or customers on this technology, we will scale back our efforts and instead focus on Node.JS as the third back-end web development language in the company.

entries.title: ASP.NET Core 5
entries.description: ASP.NET Core 5 reached end of support in May 2022, meaning all projects using it or any other previous versions of the framework should upgrade to version 6 as soon as possible.

timeline.description: ASP.NET Core 5 reached end of support in May 2022, meaning all projects using it or any other previous versions of the framework should upgrade to version 6 as soon as possible.

entries.title: Codeception
entries.description: Codeception is a multi-featured testing framework for PHP. It can handle unit, functional, and acceptance testing of web applications and it's powered by the already very popular PHPUnit testing framework

timeline.description: Codeception is a multi-featured testing framework for PHP. It can handle unit, functional, and acceptance testing of web applications and it's powered by the already very popular PHPUnit testing framework

entries.title: Cypress
entries.description: Cypress is an automation testing framework for front end. Can be used for end-to-end and component testing and can test anything that runs in a browser.

timeline.description: Cypress is an automation testing framework for front end. Can be used for end-to-end and component testing and can test anything that runs in a browser.

entries.title: JavaScript
entries.description: JavaScript is a scripting language used to create and control dynamic website content, i.e. anything that moves, refreshes, or otherwise changes on your screen without requiring you to manually reload a web page.

timeline.description: JavaScript is a scripting language used to create and control dynamic website content, i.e. anything that moves, refreshes, or otherwise changes on your screen without requiring you to manually reload a web page.

entries.title: Laravel Dusk
entries.description: Laravel Dusk provides an expressive, easy-to-use browser automation and testing API. By default, Dusk does not require you to install JDK or Selenium on your local computer. Instead, Dusk uses a standalone ChromeDriver installation.

timeline.description: Laravel Dusk provides an expressive, easy-to-use browser automation and testing API. By default, Dusk does not require you to install JDK or Selenium on your local computer. Instead, Dusk uses a standalone ChromeDriver installation.

entries.title: PHPUnit
entries.description: PHPUnit is a programmer-oriented testing framework for PHP.

timeline.description: PHPUnit is a programmer-oriented testing framework for PHP.

entries.title: Testcafe
entries.description: TestCafe is a pure node. js end-to-end solution for testing web apps. It takes care of all the stages: starting browsers, running tests, gathering test results and generating reports. TestCafe doesn't need browser plugins - it works in all popular modern browsers out-of-the-box.

timeline.description: TestCafe is a pure node. js end-to-end solution for testing web apps. It takes care of all the stages: starting browsers, running tests, gathering test results and generating reports. TestCafe doesn't need browser plugins - it works in all popular modern browsers out-of-the-box.

entries.title: Behat
entries.description:
Is used for API scripts and is used with the in-house developed extension.
Behat is an open source Behavior-Driven Development framework for PHP. It is a tool to support you in delivering software that matters through continuous communication, deliberate discovery and test-automation.

timeline.description:
Is used for API scripts and is used with the in-house developed extension.
Behat is an open source Behavior-Driven Development framework for PHP. It is a tool to support you in delivering software that matters through continuous communication, deliberate discovery and test-automation.

entries.title: Selenium
entries.description: SELENIUM is a free (open-source) automated testing framework used to validate web applications across different browsers and platforms. You can use multiple programming languages like Java, C#, Python etc to create Selenium Test Scripts. Testing done using the Selenium tool is usually referred to as Selenium Testing.

timeline.description: SELENIUM is a free (open-source) automated testing framework used to validate web applications across different browsers and platforms. You can use multiple programming languages like Java, C#, Python etc to create Selenium Test Scripts. Testing done using the Selenium tool is usually referred to as Selenium Testing.

entries.title: Adobe Experience Manager 6.x
entries.description: Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), is a comprehensive content management solution for building websites, mobile apps and forms.

timeline.description: Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), is a comprehensive content management solution for building websites, mobile apps and forms.

entries.title: Wordpress
entries.description: WordPress (WordPress.org) is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database.

timeline.description: WordPress (WordPress.org) is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database.

entries.title: Backstop.JS
entries.description: BackstopJS automates visual regression testing of your responsive web UI by comparing DOM screenshots over time.

timeline.description: BackstopJS automates visual regression testing of your responsive web UI by comparing DOM screenshots over time.

entries.title: Browserstack
entries.description: BrowserStack is a cloud web and mobile testing platform that enables developers and QA to test their websites and mobile applications across on-demand browsers, operating systems and real mobile devices, without requiring users to install or maintain an internal lab of virtual machines, devices or emulators.

timeline.description: BrowserStack is a cloud web and mobile testing platform that enables developers and QA to test their websites and mobile applications across on-demand browsers, operating systems and real mobile devices, without requiring users to install or maintain an internal lab of virtual machines, devices or emulators.

entries.title: Gitlab
entries.description: GitLab is a web-based DevOps lifecycle tool that provides a Git-repository manager providing wiki, issue-tracking and continuous integration/continuous deployment pipeline features.

timeline.description: GitLab is a web-based DevOps lifecycle tool that provides a Git-repository manager providing wiki, issue-tracking and continuous integration/continuous deployment pipeline features.

entries.title: Jira
entries.description: Jira is a a project tracking tool used for documenting test cases and bug tracking.

timeline.description: Jira is a a project tracking tool used for documenting test cases and bug tracking.

entries.title: Jmeter
entries.description: JMeter is used to analyze and measure the performance of web application or a variety of services

timeline.description: JMeter is used to analyze and measure the performance of web application or a variety of services

entries.title: Postman
entries.description: Postman is a tool used for testing APIs.

timeline.description: Postman is a tool used for testing APIs.

entries.title: Taurus
entries.description: Taurus is a tool that provides a simple way to create and run performance tests, as well as an easy integration with additional open-source functional and performance testing software, like Selenium, Gatling or JMeter. Taurus uses YAML files, which are very easy to understand.

timeline.description: Taurus is a tool that provides a simple way to create and run performance tests, as well as an easy integration with additional open-source functional and performance testing software, like Selenium, Gatling or JMeter. Taurus uses YAML files, which are very easy to understand.

entries.title: Tsung
entries.description: Tsung is a robust, load-testing tool used to benchmark the performance of instant messaging servers.

timeline.description: Tsung is a robust, load-testing tool used to benchmark the performance of instant messaging servers.

entries.title: Xray
entries.description: Xray is a complete Test Management tool for Jira. Xray supports the entire testing life cycle: test planning, test design, test execution and test reporting.

timeline.description: Xray is a complete Test Management tool for Jira. Xray supports the entire testing life cycle: test planning, test design, test execution and test reporting.

entries.title: Zephyr
entries.description: The Zephyr tool suite gives you integrated quality metrics that deliver real time visibility of your projects development progress and status. This capability stems from our unrivalled integration with Jira and a range of other key development and test products.

timeline.description: The Zephyr tool suite gives you integrated quality metrics that deliver real time visibility of your projects development progress and status. This capability stems from our unrivalled integration with Jira and a range of other key development and test products.

entries.title: Jenkins
entries.description: Jenkins – an open source automation server which enables developers around the world to reliably build, test, and deploy their software.

timeline.description: Jenkins – an open source automation server which enables developers around the world to reliably build, test, and deploy their software.

entries.title: Redmine
entries.description: Redmine is a a project tracking tool used for documenting test cases and bug tracking.

timeline.description: Redmine is a a project tracking tool used for documenting test cases and bug tracking.

entries.title: Kibana
entries.description: Kibana is a visual interface tool that allows you to explore, visualize, and build a dashboard of the logs, it is used by QA to troubleshoot various errors.

timeline.description: Kibana is a visual interface tool that allows you to explore, visualize, and build a dashboard of the logs, it is used by QA to troubleshoot various errors.

entries.title: k6
entries.description: k6 is an open source framework built to make performance testing fun for developers. k6 stands out because of its ability to encapsulate usability and performance while also bundling tools like a command-line interface to execute scripts and a dashboard to monitor the test run results

timeline.description: k6 is an open source framework built to make performance testing fun for developers. k6 stands out because of its ability to encapsulate usability and performance while also bundling tools like a command-line interface to execute scripts and a dashboard to monitor the test run results

entries.title: knex
entries.description:
Knex.js (pronounced /kəˈnɛks/) is a "batteries included" SQL query builder for PostgreSQL, CockroachDB, MSSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite3, Better-SQLite3, Oracle, and Amazon Redshift designed to be flexible, portable, and fun to use.

It features both traditional node style callbacks as well as a promise interface for cleaner async flow control, a stream interface, full-featured query and schema builders, transaction support (with savepoints), connection pooling and standardized responses between different query clients and dialects.

timeline.description:
Knex.js (pronounced /kəˈnɛks/) is a "batteries included" SQL query builder for PostgreSQL, CockroachDB, MSSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite3, Better-SQLite3, Oracle, and Amazon Redshift designed to be flexible, portable, and fun to use.

It features both traditional node style callbacks as well as a promise interface for cleaner async flow control, a stream interface, full-featured query and schema builders, transaction support (with savepoints), connection pooling and standardized responses between different query clients and dialects.

entries.title: Magento
entries.description: Magento is now Adobe Commerce. Build multichannel experiences for B2B and B2C customers on a single eCommerce platform. Magento1/Magento 2

timeline.description: Magento is now Adobe Commerce. Build multichannel experiences for B2B and B2C customers on a single eCommerce platform. Magento1/Magento 2

entries.title: C#
entries.description: # is an object-oriented, component-oriented programming language. C# provides language constructs to directly support these concepts, making C# a natural language in which to create and use software components. Since its origin, C# has added features to support new workloads and emerging software design practices. At its core, C# is an object-oriented language. You define types and their behavior.

timeline.description: # is an object-oriented, component-oriented programming language. C# provides language constructs to directly support these concepts, making C# a natural language in which to create and use software components. Since its origin, C# has added features to support new workloads and emerging software design practices. At its core, C# is an object-oriented language. You define types and their behavior.

entries.title: Appium
entries.description: Appium is an open-source tool for automating native, mobile web, and hybrid applications on iOS mobile, Android mobile, and Windows desktop platforms.

timeline.description: Appium is an open-source tool for automating native, mobile web, and hybrid applications on iOS mobile, Android mobile, and Windows desktop platforms.

entries.title: Functional testing
entries.description: Verify that the software operates according to its specifications, ensuring each function of the application works as intended. Functional testing is crucial for validating the correctness of the application’s behavior. It can be manual or automated, and it ensures that the software meets the requirements and expectations.

timeline.description: Verify that the software operates according to its specifications, ensuring each function of the application works as intended. Functional testing is crucial for validating the correctness of the application’s behavior. It can be manual or automated, and it ensures that the software meets the requirements and expectations.

entries.title: Automated testing
entries.description: Automate the execution of tests to increase efficiency, reduce manual effort, and provide quick feedback on code changes. Automated testing spans across various types of testing, including unit, functional, integration, and regression tests. It is essential for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, allowing for rapid and reliable validation of software. We are using tools like Testcafe, Cypress, Appium for UI tests and PHPUnit, PactumJS and Codeception for functional and API tests

timeline.description: Automate the execution of tests to increase efficiency, reduce manual effort, and provide quick feedback on code changes. Automated testing spans across various types of testing, including unit, functional, integration, and regression tests. It is essential for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, allowing for rapid and reliable validation of software. We are using tools like Testcafe, Cypress, Appium for UI tests and PHPUnit, PactumJS and Codeception for functional and API tests

entries.title: Performance testing
entries.description: Assess the software’s performance under various conditions, including load, stress, and scalability tests, to ensure it meets performance criteria. Performance testing is critical for understanding how an application behaves under expected and peak conditions. It helps in identifying bottlenecks and ensuring that the software can handle the required load without degradation. We are using tools like jMeter, k6 or Taurus to perform stress and load tests

timeline.description: Assess the software’s performance under various conditions, including load, stress, and scalability tests, to ensure it meets performance criteria. Performance testing is critical for understanding how an application behaves under expected and peak conditions. It helps in identifying bottlenecks and ensuring that the software can handle the required load without degradation. We are using tools like jMeter, k6 or Taurus to perform stress and load tests

entries.title: PactumJS
entries.description: PactumJS is a free & open-source REST API Automation library for all levels in a Test Pyramid written in JavaScript. Write general, component, integration, contract & e2e tests for REST APIs with this library. There are many HTTP client, HTTP server & assertion packages available in the Node.

timeline.description: PactumJS is a free & open-source REST API Automation library for all levels in a Test Pyramid written in JavaScript. Write general, component, integration, contract & e2e tests for REST APIs with this library. There are many HTTP client, HTTP server & assertion packages available in the Node.

entries.title: Playwright
entries.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API. Playwright is built to enable cross-browser web automation that is ever-green, capable, reliable and fast.

timeline.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API. Playwright is built to enable cross-browser web automation that is ever-green, capable, reliable and fast.

entries.title: Github Copilot
entries.description: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered code assistant that promises to automate repetitive code writing tasks, while also being able to generate small blocks of code based on context. Although we feel like using Copilot incurs some extra debugging time, the experience seems to be net positive and we're inclined to recommend its adoption at the company level given the reasonable pricing.

timeline.description: GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered code assistant that promises to automate repetitive code writing tasks, while also being able to generate small blocks of code based on context. Although we feel like using Copilot incurs some extra debugging time, the experience seems to be net positive and we're inclined to recommend its adoption at the company level given the reasonable pricing.

entries.title: Specflow
entries.description: SpecFlow is an open-source project. The source code is hosted on GitHub. The feature files used by SpecFlow to store an acceptance criterion for features (use cases, user stories) in your application are defined using the Gherkin syntax. The Gherkin format was introduced by Cucumber and is also used by other tools.

timeline.description: SpecFlow is an open-source project. The source code is hosted on GitHub. The feature files used by SpecFlow to store an acceptance criterion for features (use cases, user stories) in your application are defined using the Gherkin syntax. The Gherkin format was introduced by Cucumber and is also used by other tools.
